reasoning: This task requires new architectural patterns (configurable trigger system, rate limiting), database schema design for trend analysis, and cross-cutting changes affecting 10+ files across multiple services. No external integrations, but the complexity comes from designing interconnected components that must work together reliably.

scope.notes: Frontend (survey modal, admin dashboard), backend (API endpoints, trigger logic, rate limiting), database schema, possibly event handlers for triggers

integrations.notes: No external integrations. May need charting library for dashboard but likely already exists in codebase

infrastructure.notes: New database schema for NPS responses and survey history. Environment variables for trigger configuration (timing, frequency limits)

knowledge.notes: No existing NPS/survey infrastructure. Need to design new patterns for trigger system and rate limiting, but using standard web technologies

concerns: Rate limiting must prevent survey fatigue
Database schema must support trend analysis
Survey UX must be truly non-intrusive
risk.notes: Primary risk is poor user experience if surveys become annoying. Secondary risk is data model not supporting needed analytics

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Database schema changes and user data collection require thorough testing. Unit tests for trigger logic and rate limiting, integration tests for end-to-end survey flow. No security scan needed as data is non-sensitive feedback.
